Lp spaces

Let {fn}n\set{f_n}_n{fn​}n​ be a bounded sequence in L2(R)L^2\p{\R}L2(R) and suppose that fn→0f_n \to 0fn​→0 Lebesgue almost everywhere. Show that fn→0f_n \to 0fn​→0 in the weak topology on L2(R)L^2\p{\R}L2(R).
Solution.

Let g∈L2(R)g \in L^2\p{\R}g∈L2(R) and ε>0\epsilon > 0ε>0. Then there exists R>0R > 0R>0 such that

(∫∣x∣>R∣g∣2 dx)1/2<ε\p{\int_{\abs{x}>R} \abs{g}^2 \,\diff{x}}^{1/2} < \epsilon(∫∣x∣>R​∣g∣2dx)1/2<ε

since ∣g∣2\abs{g}^2∣g∣2 is integrable. Also, E↦∫E∣g∣2 dxE \mapsto \int_E \abs{g}^2 \,\diff{x}E↦∫E​∣g∣2dx defines a measure absolutely continuous with respect to the Lebesgue measure, so there exists δ>0\delta > 0δ>0 such that if m(E)<δm\p{E} < \deltam(E)<δ, then ∫E∣g∣2 dx<ε2\int_E \abs{g}^2 \,\diff{x} < \epsilon^2∫E​∣g∣2dx<ε2.

On [−R,R]\br{-R, R}[−R,R], which is a finite measure set, we may apply Egorov's theorem to get a measurable set E⊆[−R,R]E \subseteq \br{-R, R}E⊆[−R,R] such that m(E)<δm\p{E} < \deltam(E)<δ and so that fn→0f_n \to 0fn​→0 uniformly on [−R,R]∖E\br{-R, R} \setminus E[−R,R]∖E. Thus, if M=sup⁡n∥fn∥L2M = \sup_n \norm{f_n}_{L^2}M=supn​∥fn​∥L2​ and nnn is large enough, we have ∣fn∣≤ε\abs{f_n} \leq \epsilon∣fn​∣≤ε on [−R,R]∖E\br{-R, R} \setminus E[−R,R]∖E and so by Cauchy-Schwarz,

∣∫Rfng dx∣≤∫[−R,R]∖E∣fng∣ dx+∫E∣fng∣ dx+∫{∣x∣>R}∣fng∣ dx≤(∫[−R,R]∖E∣fn∣2 dx)1/2∥g∥L2+∥fn∥L2(∫E∣g∣2 dx)1/2+∥fn∥L2(∫{∣x∣>R}∣g∣2 dx)1/2≤∥g∥L2ε+Mε+Mε.\begin{aligned} \abs{\int_\R f_ng \,\diff{x}} &\leq \int_{\br{-R,R} \setminus E} \abs{f_ng} \,\diff{x} + \int_E \abs{f_ng} \,\diff{x} + \int_{\set{\abs{x}>R}} \abs{f_ng} \,\diff{x} \\ &\leq \p{\int_{\br{-R,R} \setminus E} \abs{f_n}^2 \,\diff{x}}^{1/2} \norm{g}_{L^2} + \norm{f_n}_{L^2}\p{\int_E \abs{g}^2 \,\diff{x}}^{1/2} + \norm{f_n}_{L^2}\p{\int_{\set{\abs{x}>R}} \abs{g}^2 \,\diff{x}}^{1/2} \\ &\leq \norm{g}_{L^2}\epsilon + M\epsilon + M\epsilon. \end{aligned}∣∣​∫R​fn​gdx∣∣​​≤∫[−R,R]∖E​∣fn​g∣dx+∫E​∣fn​g∣dx+∫{∣x∣>R}​∣fn​g∣dx≤(∫[−R,R]∖E​∣fn​∣2dx)1/2∥g∥L2​+∥fn​∥L2​(∫E​∣g∣2dx)1/2+∥fn​∥L2​(∫{∣x∣>R}​∣g∣2dx)1/2≤∥g∥L2​ε+Mε+Mε.​

Sending ε→0\epsilon \to 0ε→0, we get the claim.
